snippet: Pakistan’s ban on NATO truck traffic to protest a deadly American airstrike has increased demand on Afghanistan’s sketchy infrastructure everywhere, and on one tunnel in particular.
abstract: Pakistan’s ban on NATO truck traffic to protest a deadly American airstrike has increased demand on Afghanistan’s sketchy infrastructure; for 20 miles north and south of the old Soviet-built tunnel at Salang Pass, thousands of trucks are idled beside the road, waiting for a turn to get through its perilous, one-and-a-half-mile length.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan’s ban on NATO truck traffic to protest a deadly American airstrike has increased demand on Afghanistan’s sketchy infrastructure everywhere, and on one tunnel in particular.

headline.seo: U.S-Pakistan Dispute Chokes an Afghan Supply Route
headline.main: U.S.-Pakistan Freeze Chokes Fallback Route in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Pakistan Dispute Chokes an Afghan Supply Route
